properties.areaDesc: Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Northwest Blue Mountains
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 6 at 12:47PM PST until January 6 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Pendleton OR
properties.description:
...Snow will continue in the Blue Mountains through this evening...

.Pacific moisture continues to overspread the region and bring
snow to the Blue Mtns. Storm total snow accumulations 5 to 10
inches are expected. Breezy winds could lead to areas of blowing
and drifting snow.

* WHAT...Snow above 3500 feet. Additional snow accumulations of up
to 5 inches with storm accumulations up to 10 inches. Highest
snow totals will focus on high terrain north of Oregon Route
204. Winds will be breezy, and could produce blowing or
drifting snow

* WHERE...In Washington, Northwest Blue Mountains. In Oregon,
Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon.

* WHEN...Until 7 PM PST this evening.

* IMPACTS...Travel could become difficult, particularly on Oregon
Route 204. Breezy conditions may lead to blowing or drifting
snow. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening
commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST THIS EVENING ABOVE 3500 FEET
